metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1548 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 31.0 and Thunderbird before 31.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1548` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
